ETYMOLOGY: From Japanese 相撲 (sumō), from sumafu, an archaic Japanese verb meaning 'to wrestle'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A form of Japanese wrestling in which a wrestler wins by forcing his opponent out of a circular ring or by making him touch the ground with any part of his body other than the soles of his feet.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种日本摔跤形式，选手通过将对手推出圆形场地或使其身体除脚底外任何部分触地而获胜。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He dreamed of becoming a grand champion in sumo wrestling.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他梦想成为相扑的最高级别冠军。
